Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav cracked a 28-ball 53 to set India up for a convincing 47-run win over Afghanistan
India posted 181 for eight at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados
Afghanistan struggled in response, particularly against Jasprit Bumrah, and were always struggling after being reduced to 23 for three
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Super Eights come thick and fast – tomorrow Australia take on Bangladesh in the early game, and England return to the Daren Sammy Stadium to battle South Africa at 3.30BST
Others: India had made a sluggish start with Rashid Khan (three for 26) instrumental as they slipped to 90 for four
Rishabh Pant (20) and Virat Kohli (24) were among the leg-spinner’s victims after Fazalhaq Farooqi (three for 33) had claimed the early scalp of captain Rohit Sharma
Azmatullah Omarzai hit a battling 26 and Najibullah Zadran scored 19, but the outcome was determined long before the finish as Arshdeep Singh (two for 34) and Kuldeep Yadav (two for 32) also shone
